Text: For years, we have fought to give Utahns a say in the care and the management of our lands. Biden had the opportunity to give us just that. Though he has so far passed that up, we will not stop making sure Utahns’ voices are heard loud and clear. https://t.co/Yj7NuZsBcm

We’ve been clear about our willingness to work with the President on a permanent legislative solution to the boundaries and management of Bears Ears and Grand Staircase-Escalante national monuments. His go-at-it-alone strategy only further divides us. https://t.co/Yj7NuZsBcm

The President’s proclamation about Bears Ears and Grand Staircase-Escalante perpetuates a cycle of Antiquities Act abuse and ignores the rights and the will of Utahns, to the detriment of the lands and those whose lives are most intertwined with them. https://t.co/Yj7NuZsBcm

We will continue to support efforts to ensure that Bears Ears & Grand Staircase-Escalante's boundaries & management reflect the unique stakeholder interest and uses in the area, but today’s “winner take all” mentality moved us further away from that goal.https://t.co/FwMsLO0KMr

The President squandered the opportunity to build consensus by working with stakeholders to find a permanent, legislative solution to resolve the longstanding dispute over the monuments' boundaries & management, which would've brought certainty to and benefited all stakeholders.

Yet again, Utah's national monuments are being used as a political football between administrations. The decision to re-expand the boundaries of Bears Ears and Grand Staircase-Escalante is a devastating blow to our state, local, and tribal leaders and our delegation.

Amid significant threats posed by China's illicit actions and global ascendancy, the U.S. Ambassador to China is one of the most consequential diplomatic positions to hold. Met with Nicholas Burns to discuss his nomination and the strategic posture we must have with China. https://t.co/LSQUuAQEMl
Receiving this terrible news with a heavy heart. My prayers are with Mafatini’s family, teammates, and friends. https://t.co/8ROyNiuUyS

It is unacceptable that our bipartisan infrastructure bill, which is vital to our economy and necessary to keep important transportation programs going, is being held hostage by the most extreme House Democrats for a completely unrelated and still unwritten piece of legislation. https://t.co/Pj1gKU3GqU

Tracy Stone-Manning's history of aiding ecoterrorists—and her attempt to conceal it from the Senate—make her unfit to serve as Director of @BLMNational. Utahns deserve to have our 23 million acres of public lands managed by someone we can trust—and Ms. Stone-Manning isn't it. https://t.co/PI8f1Nxdge

The $3.5 trillion reconciliation bill being pushed by Democrats will actually make U.S. companies less competitive abroad. Their bill will put us at a disadvantage with China in foreign markets by increasing taxes on our companies’ earnings overseas. https://t.co/GSZs6YATrL

I support helping families with children, but the Democrats' $3.5T plan is superfluous and irresponsible. Their programs will put families in a bind–either by increasing taxes, making families more dependent on the federal government, or sidelining them when the programs expire. https://t.co/3wizzXk49z

Don't be fooled: Democrats' plans for free child care and universal pre-K expire in a handful of years—they aren't permanent. It's wrong to let families start planning for and relying on these programs only for them to disappear. That's a bait-and-switch! https://t.co/zbv727i4g6

Marriage is a vital social good, and the foundation of strong families and strong communities. The Democrats’ $3.5 trillion spending bill would increase the penalties for marriage. It is misguided and unfair to disincentive couples from marrying. https://t.co/MMeqrhagYN

Democrats are pushing for a $3.5 trillion reconciliation bill, which will bring nothing but bad news to our country. Their so-called “build back better” initiative will raise taxes on hardworking Americans to fund a series of expensive and frivolous measures on their wish-list. https://t.co/5HOktMQkmI

Democrats' $3.5 trillion spending spree would provide monthly checks, free community college, and free child care to people who are in our country illegally. I can’t think of a better way to exacerbate the crisis at our southern border. https://t.co/mR5XvcAnTP

Utahns on both sides of the aisle agree that we need to update our physical infrastructure. Our roads are in need of repair, many rural communities lack reliable internet, and our transit systems need expansion. Our bipartisan bill would put Utah's infrastructure back on track. https://t.co/NmHZAaM5K8

The U.S. cannot allow China to threaten the wellbeing of free people and nations. We must counter China’s efforts to undermine global order when we see them—including in international organizations. Met with @USAmbUN to discuss China and our presence at the @UN General Assembly. https://t.co/sx93efkz6X

Our bipartisan infrastructure bill funds essential projects that will directly support Utah's growing economy. Welcomed @SVUTChamber, @ChamberWestUT, @stgeorgechamber, and @DavisChamberUT to DC for a discussion on the infrastructure bill & challenges facing Utah’s job creators. https://t.co/feSDPoFuMT

Our bipartisan infrastructure bill meets Utah's needs for additional physical infrastructure, without increasing taxes. It also brings running water to the 40% of Utah's Navajos who lack it. I urge my House colleagues to deliver this win for our state. https://t.co/ZQRu5TeMcF

Secretary Blinken also confirmed that the Taliban hasn't severed ties to Al Qaeda. These re-emerging terrorist threats are made worse by the Administration's disastrous withdrawal from Afghanistan. The Administration must be prepared to eliminate threats as they emerge. https://t.co/AhxDX1tuco
The thinking by Democrats that increased taxes on businesses will not be passed directly on to consumers is, simply put, folly.

Democrats have made clear that they don't need Republican votes to spend outrageous sums of money, so it follows that they won't be getting our votes to borrow for it. They control the House, the Senate, and the White House–it's on them to avoid a disastrous default.

The Administration must be held accountable for their disastrous withdrawal from Afghanistan. Our bill provides oversight tools to ensure that Americans & our partners are evacuated, imposes sanctions on the Taliban, & develops a counterterrorism strategy. https://t.co/Eew1jrqNlM

Utahns agree–the bipartisan infrastructure bill addresses our state’s critical infrastructure needs:

→$2.7 billion to construct & maintain roads, bridges, and highways
→helps prevent & mitigate wildfires
→expands broadband
→brings water to the 40% of Utah Navajos who lack it https://t.co/nICXfElclj

Congratulations to Utah’s own @tonyfinaugolf for helping Team USA secure this win! It was great to see the youngest @RyderCupUSA team in history win with the largest margin of victory in the modern era. https://t.co/OIpgExjqz2
A life taken too soon—a young man who was a leader on and off of the field. Praying for Aaron’s family, loved ones, @Utah_Football teammates, and the @UUtah community. https://t.co/2fzqxbhpLa

E-cigarettes continue to pose a great risk to our youth. By delaying a decision on whether vaping products provide more public health benefit than harm to youth, the @US_FDA is continuing to place young people at risk of exposure to these harmful products. https://t.co/0d60JgCMRl

With Utah's rapid growth and economic expansion, it's essential that we invest in our physical infrastructure. Enjoyed traveling throughout our state this summer to meet with Utahns to discuss how the bipartisan infrastructure bill will meet Utah's needs without raising taxes. https://t.co/oUdBBI4wHv

This heartbreaking news is a solemn reminder of the immeasurable sacrifices made by our servicemembers. Ann and I are keeping Staff Sgt. Olmstead's wife and children in our prayers. https://t.co/cc71BbPALu

After meeting with community leaders and organizations throughout Utah, it’s clear that there is overwhelming support for the bipartisan infrastructure bill. It's high time we get it across the finish line. https://t.co/xqm46RwMYk

Apprenticeships play a valuable role in ensuring that Utah has a well-educated & skilled workforce. The Administration's plan to sideline the program that promotes private industry participation in workforce training would hurt apprenticeship-seekers in Utah & across the country. https://t.co/xJaZfAZDyD

Met with @BYUCougars Athletics Director @TomHolmoe to discuss their Built For Life program and the outlook for collegiate sports. We also celebrated some exciting things happening at @BYU, including joining the @Big12Conference and some recent wins on the football field! #GoCougs https://t.co/qr94M6AeUl

Utah takes great pride in having served as host of the 2002 Winter @Olympics. Enjoyed reminiscing about the Salt Lake City Games with members of the International Olympic Committee. Seems like a no-brainer to bring the games back to the Beehive State, if you ask me! https://t.co/BUaRMVuNgK

Utah’s public lands are best managed by communities closest to them–not DC. It is a mistake to uproot the @BLMNational headquarters from the West–which made it easier for local officials, tribes, ranchers, and the public to meet with those who oversee BLM’s multiple use mission. https://t.co/lYpPTN5oXU

My friend Jeff Flake is a thoughtful and accomplished public servant who will represent the United States well in a complex region of the world. He understands the importance of standing for US interests in Turkey, and I look forward to supporting his nomination for Ambassador. https://t.co/Vqzxoyna9u

The rise in threats of domestic violence and extremism to our country is alarming. We must ensure our systems are organized and effective to address both terrorist threats grown here at home and those formed abroad. https://t.co/0el758LyxD

The President's "human infrastructure bill" would allow illegal immigrants to get $300/month, per child, by obtaining a tax ID number once they're here. It's outrageous. I can't think of a more enticing reason to enter our country illegally–at the expense of American tax payers. https://t.co/nnIX9EMwjz

We must focus on addressing the pull-factors that draw people into our country illegally. The Administration's plan to focus solely on the "root causes" of illegal immigration is simply not feasible. We can't eradicate poverty and crime here at home, let alone around the world. https://t.co/mrrxxid4MR

The Biden Administration's border and immigration policies have been nothing short of a monumental disaster. Were there not so many other disasters the Administration is encountering, it would be, by itself, enough for a government to be hanging on by a thread. https://t.co/sAd2nynZBW

A changing climate is one of the biggest issues we face—and it will require bipartisan solutions to make a real impact. I look forward to continuing to work with @SenatorBennet on solutions to address wildfires, droughts & other challenges facing the West. https://t.co/wVqB46ztd0

What we're witnessing in Utah & throughout the West is an historic drought. Spent the day with @SenatorBennet, @LGHendersonUtah, and local leaders from Utah & Colorado on a float trip down the Colorado River to start building consensus on solutions to the West’s water challenges. https://t.co/zlFiyrBj2M

The Constitution forms the base of our democratic republic, a country that guarantees and safeguards the unalienable right of every person.

Enjoyed celebrating #ConstitutionDay at @BYU’s Wheatley Institution. https://t.co/1W7F99L4oq

The Kohler family has been staunch advocates for Heber Valley’s agricultural industry for nearly a century. Grateful for their decision to protect the Albert Kohler Legacy Farm to ensure that the lessons and values learned on a farm are maintained for future generations. https://t.co/tK6LZ3bvDV

We must listen respectfully to the opinions of others, expand our sources of information beyond those we agree with, defend the Constitution, and vote for men & women of character & probity.

The Founders gave us a Republic. As Benjamin Franklin said, it is up to us to keep it. https://t.co/WiI4ARIqYM

Eliminating the filibuster would forever change one of the key institutions of our Republic, one that protects political minorities from the tyranny of the majority. The filibuster forces compromise, ensuring that significant changes to our democracy are made by broad consensus. https://t.co/n0LOnCSFpk

While today's autocracies, led by China, are becoming stronger, our resolve to follow the Constitution's path is wavering. Groups, politicians & pundits on both sides of the aisle are challenging constitutional & institutional guardrails–putting our democratic republic at risk. https://t.co/ckOD02X2Yc

Authoritarianism is in ascendency:
 
Putin murders his political opponents. 
 
Maduro brutalizes those who have not already fled. 
 
Assad has killed hundreds of thousands of his Syrian countrymen. 
 
And sadly, the Taliban flag flies atop the presidential palace in Afghanistan. https://t.co/tcSKJs4cCh

China censors its media, shreds its promise of self-rule for Hong Kong, and oppresses its people. And what the Chinese Communist Party is perpetrating on the Uyghurs—the genocide of nearly one million people—is an atrocity not seen or imagined coming from a nation in our era. https://t.co/pRboFzyxP6

The Constitution is the foundation of our democratic republic—and safeguards the unalienable and fundamental rights of every person. Our Founders worked assiduously to escape the perilous attraction of authoritarianism. https://t.co/VmP9feULtJ
Live soon → I’ll be speaking at @BYUWheatley to celebrate #ConstitutionDay. Watch here: https://t.co/mq6DotqyY9

Utah’s skilled and motivated workforce attracts businesses–especially those in tech and financial services sectors–to set up shop here. Enjoyed participating in a fireside chat with @PresidentUofU Taylor Randall at @UUtah’s FinTech Summit. Watch here: https://t.co/02tLT0UEGB https://t.co/AD88guinMm
Looking forward to joining @UUtah’s inaugural FinTech Summit in just a few moments. Tune in ↓https://t.co/AAWtw1mm3t

Enjoyed meeting with @BradLMortensen, President of @WeberStateU, to discuss the university’s strategic plan for growth and its efforts to expand aerospace capabilities in the region. This new helmet will look “great, great great” in my office! https://t.co/cZsW5kIDpl
Credit unions play an essential role in Utah’s unique and growing economy. Received an update from members and leaders of @UtahsCUs in my D.C. office. https://t.co/xd3q1WyOlH

Utah continues to lead the nation in economic strength and growth–it's simply a great place to start and run a business! Grateful to @SaltLakeChamber for visiting Washington to discuss how we can better support businesses along the Wasatch Front. https://t.co/IAumPjh87K

The Taliban's takeover was a probability that should have been planned for. Secretary Blinken admitted that the Administration took a “risk” by not pushing the withdrawal deadline back further—which would have provided the time needed to safely evacuate U.S. citizens & partners. https://t.co/8kbR7Hia8y

In the last two decades since 9/11, we have asked our servicemembers to do so much to keep us safe, and they have responded with uncommon courage. May God bless our nation’s fallen and wounded, and may God bless their families and all of our servicemembers in harm’s way 🇺🇸 https://t.co/v8aiRZsvkl

Cpl. Wyatt Wilson of Carbon County, Utah, sustained serious injury while supporting evacuation efforts at the Kabul airport during the terrorist attacks on August 26. Our nation thanks you for answering the call to serve with valor & devotion, and we pray for your swift recovery. https://t.co/Yt8GlIhtF3

Utah’s Taylor Hoover was just 11 years old on 9/11. Nine years later, he was a Staff Sergeant in the @USMC.
 
On August 26, he was among the 13 U.S. servicemembers who upheld their sacred oath at the cost of their own lives. We will never forget his bravery and heroism that day. https://t.co/el0XbOl5Vw

Soon, I'll speak on the Senate floor to honor the sacrifice and bravery of fallen Utah servicemember Staff Sgt. Taylor Hoover, who we lost during the terrorist attacks at the Kabul airport. Watch here: https://t.co/g9ww8FTi6m

An alarming number of U.S. legal permanent residents and partners, including SIV applicants, have been left behind to face the Taliban. We must keep our commitment to these groups and ensure they are safely evacuated from Afghanistan. https://t.co/fJgVl0uNnt

The Taliban’s ties to Al Qaeda have not been severed, and they have sympathy and collaboration with other terrorists groups. Now that Afghanistan is under Taliban control, the Administration must be prepared to respond to reemerging terrorist threats. https://t.co/SdEiMLQLKA

What struck me the most after the attacks on 9/11 was the unity we felt as Americans for our country–the boundaries between us seemed to disappear.
 
May the memory of those we lost inspire us to heal our divisions and unite us on our path forward to meet the challenges ahead. https://t.co/VVtJbM5vbv

Today, on the 20th anniversary of the terrorist attacks on 9/11, we think of those who lost their lives that tragic day and all of those who have bled and died for our freedom. May we continue to look to the American flag as a symbol of their sacrifice. https://t.co/ukOhF4GR7G

9/11 changed everything. As we come together to honor the innocent lives that were lost on that tragic day, may we be reminded of the love we felt for our fellow Americans in the aftermath of the attacks and let that unity inspire us to heal our divisions. https://t.co/YmhVM8Cfuc

Utah's economic growth does not come without challenges. Joined a roundtable discussion with members of the @UMAssoc to discuss difficulties that the manufacturing industry is facing, including labor shortages and intellectual property theft from adversaries like China. https://t.co/kQuxpXWTCw
Congratulations to Syracuse native and @TeamUSA athlete @hunterwoodhall for taking home bronze in the 400m T62! Amazing work on the track–you make us proud. https://t.co/bYBNkdRyh5
Outstanding performance from @USAWGoalball. Congratulations to Salt Lake City’s Marybai Huking for her excellence in helping secure the silver medal for @TeamUSA! https://t.co/eTMjeL83e6

Keeping the residents of Hanksville in our prayers after being hit with such major flooding. Thankful for the swift action of our first responders—and that there were no injuries. https://t.co/kgfmWbC7ta

China's quest to become the world's leading power is one of the greatest threats facing the U.S.

Met with Strider Technologies in South Jordan to learn about their efforts to mitigate supply chain vulnerabilities and prevent IP theft from foreign adversaries like the CCP. https://t.co/0oX0oTdRHc

Congratulations to the Utahns competing for @TeamUSA in the @Paralympics! Your matchless athleticism, grit, and determination are an inspiration to us all. We wish you the best in Tokyo! https://t.co/6Qs79XDRUG

Included in the bill is the Smart Intersections Act, which will help build better intersections in Utah and across the country—reducing wait times at red lights, improving traffic flow, and helping officials respond more efficiently to highway incidents. https://t.co/mHduOfkqGp

Toured @UtahDOT’s Traffic Operations Center and met with Executive Director @CarlosUDOT to discuss how the funding provided in our bipartisan infrastructure bill will help Utah expand and improve its physical infrastructure. https://t.co/2Y3PvpKzeH

This loss tears at our collective soul. As we read their stories, it is apparent that these brave men and women truly represent our very best and finest. God bless our fallen servicemembers. Your sacrifice will not be forgotten. You will not be forgotten 🇺🇸 https://t.co/vuwwF0h9YC
Praying for the safety and well-being of all those in the path of #HurricaneIda. Please do all you can to stay safe and follow necessary protocols. https://t.co/NSn6OBTNSi

We have a moral responsibility to welcome people into our country who put their lives—and their families’ lives—at risk to fight alongside our troops. Our Afghan partners are owed our gratitude and a warm welcome into the United States. https://t.co/MBr3VgNxrB

We must not forget what radical jihadists did on 9/11. We were in Afghanistan to prevent another tragedy on U.S. soil, yet now we're pulling out amid rising threats. Maintaining a small presence in places of hostility helps to ensure that that hostility doesn't come to America. https://t.co/ljq3Tn9gVg

It takes two sides to end a war—and the Taliban and violent jihadists haven't stopped fighting. The war isn't over, we're just no longer there. And now America is in more danger. https://t.co/ihRj6FuL1A

What's happening in Afghanistan is a humanitarian and foreign policy tragedy–both the current and prior administration have made terrible decisions. Leaving Americans and our Afghan partners behind would put upon the U.S. a great moral stain. https://t.co/4zHu3l2DTL

Utah is in need of additional infrastructure—roads, highways, water, broadband, and transportation—to keep up with our rapid growth. Met with members of several rural chambers of commerce this morning to discuss how the bipartisan infrastructure bill meets Utah’s critical needs. https://t.co/jBvFILaITF

The local response to the 541-acre Parleys Canyon Fire was well-executed, saving countless homes and lives. Met with @SummitCountyUT Sheriff & @PCFireDistrict to discuss lessons learned and the important wildfire provisions that are included in our bipartisan infrastructure bill. https://t.co/gXuYkJvqr4

Met with @LGHendersonUtah, State Representative @lowrysnow, and Point of the Mountain Development Commission Executive Director Alan Matheson to discuss how our bipartisan infrastructure legislation will help fulfill bold visions we have for our rapidly growing state. https://t.co/Nrjixpg4g9

A bipartisan bill is the best option we have to address Utah’s infrastructure needs, including investing in historic developments at the Point of the Mountain. Projects like these will be eligible for funding if the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act becomes law.

Between the drought and climate change, it’s critical that we continue to invest in Utah’s water resources. Joined @UtahDNR Executive Director Brian Steed to discuss how to keep the Great Salt Lake at a healthy level and how our bipartisan infrastructure bill could help efforts. https://t.co/u1PhTsRRRP

Utah is experiencing an unprecedented drought, with some precipitation levels at record lows in the Weber-Ogden region. Toured @WeberBasinWater to learn more about these challenges and discuss how our bipartisan infrastructure bill can help bolster Utah’s water infrastructure. https://t.co/ymZpLrrlB9

Utah’s strong economy makes our state a great place to start & run a business—and @LHM group is evidence of that. Visited with their employees this morning to discuss how the bipartisan infrastructure bill will benefit Utah & what the US must do to remain competitive with China. https://t.co/QxATdVVNc5

.@SVUTChamber has worked hard to support South Salt Lake County businesses during the #COVID19 pandemic. I joined my delegation colleagues to learn more about the challenges facing local business leaders and to discuss how our bipartisan infrastructure bill would benefit Utah. https://t.co/SFspwbtnjq

We cannot break our promise to our Afghan partners who are counting on our help amid the Taliban takeover. Inaction would ensure they become prime targets for retribution. The Administration must swiftly evacuate our Afghan partners and their families. https://t.co/sg1Aa7DVdj

Despite the risks, Afghan journalists have been on the front lines advancing a free & open press. Now they’ll likely face greater retribution by the Taliban. We must ensure journalists can work without fear of harm & aid evacuation efforts when in danger. https://t.co/i2TJ7vN4gt

Deeply saddened by the news of this weekend’s devastating earthquake in Haiti. My heart aches for those suffering. Our love, prayers, and support are with the people of Haiti as they endure this tragedy. https://t.co/eCoyNU6rUf

As this devastating fire spreads rapidly through Parley’s Canyon, I encourage Utahns to stay safe and avoid the area to allow fire personnel access. 

Praying for the safety of these first responders and for the residents in the area as they evacuate. https://t.co/2ox6YuMPJs

Politics should never come before our national security interests. The Administration must immediately reconsider its Afghanistan withdrawal plan. Further evidence that a crumbling Afghan government has grave implications for US security interests now, and in the future. https://t.co/mDmTG2fGBo

Nothing but lip service coming from the Administration. We have made commitments to the Afghan interpreters, and others who have provided critical assistance, that we would get them out of Afghanistan. The U.S. must not renege on our commitments amidst this push by the Taliban. https://t.co/dn6EXq9Occ

The Biden administration’s unwillingness to alter the Afghan withdrawal plan based on changing circumstances on the ground & the grave implications for US security interests is a tragedy & a cause for serious concern about how the administration will deal with global challenges. https://t.co/rM43t2uakH

More than half of the Democrats' reckless $3.5 trillion spending bill will be paid for with devastating tax increases on hardworking Americans. That's $1.75 trillion in revenue. I offered an amendment to prevent the largest tax increase in American history.https://t.co/i0OT67geI4

Washington Democrats are set to carry out a reckless tax & spending spree–pushing a $3.5 trillion bill filled with radical social spending and tax hikes. Their bill is a blue whale–it's large, soft, and very blue– and it will add massively to our already ballooning national debt.

Democrats are creating an open gateway to trillions of dollars in new taxes—on hardworking families and businesses—with little regard to half the country. Under the rules of budget reconciliation, there is no restriction on how high they can increase taxes on the American people.

Republicans will not sign up for the multitrillion-dollar spending, tax hikes, increased deficits, and expanded social programs put forth by our Democrat friends in their latest budget bill. Their proposal is a whopping $3.5 trillion. This level of spending is simply reckless.

The "budget" bill put forth by Democrats is not only detrimental to our country's fiscal health, it is destructive to the tradition of bipartisanship. Their $3.5 trillion proposal is a reckless spending spree on expanded social programs and would raise taxes on American families.
